summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to defense attorneys Brad Edwards and Brittany Henderson, notifying them of two upcoming court appearances in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell: an in-person arraignment and a remote bail appeal oral argument.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: Recipient of the email notification regarding upcoming court appearances in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: Brittany Henderson
persons.context: Recipient of the email notification regarding upcoming court appearances in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The judge who scheduled the in-person arraignment for Ghislaine Maxwell on April 23, 2021.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the case 'United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell', subject to an upcoming arraignment and bail appeal.

connections.description: Both are recipients of the legal notification email, indicating they are likely co-counsel or part of the same legal team.
Brad Edwards is a defense attorney receiving notifications about court appearances for defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.
Brittany Henderson is a defense attorney receiving notifications about court appearances for defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.
Judge Nathan is presiding over the arraignment in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: In-person Arraignment for Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Judge Nathan scheduled an in-person arraignment for Ghislaine Maxwell at 2:30 p.m. in courtroom 24B at 500 Pearl Street.

events.title: Remote Oral Argument on Maxwell's Bail Appeal
events.description: The Second Circuit scheduled a remote oral argument regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's bail appeal at 10 a.m., to be livestreamed.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (Southern District of New York)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was scheduled for an in-person arraignment on April 23, 2021, before Judge Nathan.
A remote oral argument regarding Maxwell's bail appeal was scheduled for April 26, 2021, in the Second Circuit.
The correspondence is official notification from the U.S. Attorney's Office to defense counsel about these court dates.
The document indicates ongoing legal proceedings in the high-profile case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell in early 2021.
